bibl.title: The Egyptian Gods in Midrashic Texts.
bibl.note: Demonstrates a significant awareness of Egyptian gods in rabbinic texts of late antiquity and the early medieval period. - The power struggle between the Egyptian god Ra‘ and the Hebrew God. - Egyptian "animal worship". - The cult of Isis and Serapis. - The Nile god and Moses as the child of the Nile. - The dog-headed god Anubis. - The snake Apopis. - The condemnation and destruction of Egyptian gods. - Conclusion.
bibl.seg: ULMER Rivka, The Egyptian Gods in Midrashic Texts.

Demonstrates a significant awareness of Egyptian gods in rabbinic texts of late antiquity and the early medieval period. - The power struggle between the Egyptian god Ra‘ and the Hebrew God. - Egyptian "animal worship". - The cult of Isis and Serapis. - The Nile god and Moses as the child of the Nile. - The dog-headed god Anubis. - The snake Apopis. - The condemnation and destruction of Egyptian gods. - Conclusion.
